intro: Cnesmone hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan cnesmone, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests and valleys. It produces small, elliptical fruits that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
